result.execSummary:
The defendant Wendy A Galligan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment and or school.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall not enter establishments where the primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol.
Defendant shall have no contact with John Plzak, Call of the Wild, Lighthouse Lanes, Fat Charlie's Restaurant, Marshall's Convenience Stores, Bottoms Up, Jug's Hitching Post, Olde Mill Inn, Pioneer Bowl, CC's Place, Raceway Pub & Grill and Shopko.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, including mental health.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall advise all doctors of opiate abuse/issues.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
All conditions of probation imposed in Ct. 1 shall remain same for Ct. 2.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Barbara J. Privat.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Case recalled.  Plea entered this morning on a global resolution; State moves to dismiss and read-in as uncharged read-ins the WPD #14-7464 and KPD #14-0231302C and Court directs the PSI writer to consider these uncharged read-ins.
Sentencing hearing on May 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Barbara J. Privat.  Atty Peter J. Cannon for State.  Resolution reached; PSI recommended with both sides free to argue; State moves to dismiss and read in Cts. 3-7; 13CM1199, 14CM171 14CM231 and HPD Incident #14319 and Court so orders.  Guilty plea entered on Cts. 1 and 2.  Court finds def guilty on Cts. 1 and 2.  Presentence Investigation Report ordered and report shall be filed within 10 days of sentencing.  Atty. Privat requests to be heard on bond; argument by counsel.  Court modifies bond to $2,000 cash.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Barbara J. Privat.  Atty Peter J. Cannon for State.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information within 48 hours.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 09:00 am.
